contentrichtext.text: '''X.32''' is an old [[ITU-T]] standard published in 1984 for connecting to an [[X.25]] [[computer networking|network]] by [[dial-up]]. It defines how the network identifies the [[Computer terminal|terminal]] for billing and security purposes. ==Further reading== *{{cite book |last=Friend |first=George E. |coauthors=John L. Fike, H. Charles Baker, John C. Bellamy |title=Understanding Data Communications |edition=2nd Edition |year=1988 |publisher=Howard W. Sams & Company |location=Indianapolis |isbn=0-672-27270-9 |ref=harv}} *{{cite book |last=Pooch |first=Udo W. |coauthors=William H. Greene, Gary G. Moss |title=Telecommunications and Networking |publisher=Little, Brown and Company |location=Boston |year=1983 |isbn=0-316-71498-4}} ==External links== *[http://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-X.32/en/ ITU-T Recommendation X.32] [[Category:ITU-T recommendations]] {{telecom-stub}}
